metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5710 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. The pre-defined function "strlen" is getting a "NULL" string as a parameter value in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the Key Distribution Center (KDC), which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a modified kadmin client.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-k5tls - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-kdc - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-kpropd - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-locales - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-multidev - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-otp - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-pkinit - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
krb5-user - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libgssrpc4 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libk5crypto3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libkdb5-9 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libkrad0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libkrb5-3 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
libkrb5support0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> this CVE was patched as CVE-2018-5729.

criterions.comment: krb5 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16-2ubuntu0.1').
